definition: to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross

sentences.english: Known as adjustable-rate mortgages, the loans have interest rates that can double after two years.
sentences.chinese: 这些可调利率抵押贷款也许在两年后会利率翻倍。

sentences.english: We'll double ours in a jiffy.
Hidden assets can be doubled if you play your cards correctly.
sentences.chinese: 如果你能巧妙处理，你的账外资产会翻倍。

sentences.english: Its numbers have doubled, also due to reintroduction efforts.
sentences.chinese: 它的数量已经翻倍，这也是多亏了野外放生。

sentences.english: This single degree doubled the mortality rate of some European countries.
sentences.chinese: 这仅有的一度能使某些欧洲国家的死亡率翻倍。

sentences.english: Well, now she'll be twice as jealous.
sentences.chinese: 难道让她的醋意翻倍不好吗？

sentences.english: I said, "Why? Why would it double?
sentences.chinese: 我问他“为什么，凭什么能翻倍？

sentences.english: The law doubles the number of audits required each year.
sentences.chinese: 这项法律将使今年所需的审计员名额翻倍。

sentences.english: By the time austerity measures hit 3% or more, the number of incidents has doubled.
sentences.chinese: 当紧缩达到3%及以上时，事件发生量就会翻倍。

sentences.english: Chinese trade with the Middle East has roughly doubled in the past five years.
sentences.chinese: 中国和中东地区的贸易总额在过去5年已经翻倍。

sentences.english: The company set out to nearly double its China car sales last year.
sentences.chinese: 公司去年计划实现在中国汽车销量近乎翻倍的目标。

sentences.english: Double that, times by two, this is the money I will be making in one month.
sentences.chinese: 再翻倍，乘以二，这将是我在一个月赚到的钱。

sentences.english: Should HCG levels double every 48 hours during early pregnancy?
sentences.chinese: HCG水平是否应该在怀孕前期每48小时翻倍？

sentences.english: Iput in more effort and my exam scores doubled.
sentences.chinese: 我付出更多的努力，考试分数也翻倍了。
房价已经在全国范围内翻倍了。

sentences.english: Or did I do both twice and accidentally double up? Ooooh!
sentences.chinese: “我这么做了两次，哇，意外翻倍”。

definition: to double/to increase by a certain number of times
achievement/accomplishment/(in more recent usage) performance (of a business, employee etc)/results
to double/to redouble/to increase many times over/to multiply by a factor/multiplication
to exceed/to overtake/to surpass/to transcend/to pass/to cross/ultra-/super-
extent of a rise (in prices etc)/amount of increase/growth (typically expressed as a percentage)
